1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. Qc2 d5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. Bg5 c6 7. e3 Nbd7 8. Bd3 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nf3 Re8 11. O-O Be7 12. Bg3 Nf8
comment: Now Black forms a plan to exchange his light squared Bishop for White's active piece on d3.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. Qc2 d5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. Bg5 c6 7. e3 Nbd7 8. Bd3 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nf3 Re8 11. O-O Be7 12. Bg3 Nf8 13. h3 Be6 14. Rab1
comment: Now commences the famous and formidable minority attack on the Queen side.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. Qc2 d5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. Bg5 c6 7. e3 Nbd7 8. Bd3 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nf3 Re8 11. O-O Be7 12. Bg3 Nf8 13. h3 Be6 14. Rab1 Nh5 15. Bh2 g6 16. Ne5 Ng7 17. b4 Bf5 18. Na4 Bxd3 19. Qxd3 Nd7 20. Rfc1 Nxe5 21. Bxe5 Bd6 22. Bxd6 Qxd6
comment: It seems as though Black, by his numerous exchanges has eased his position. But...

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. Qc2 d5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. Bg5 c6 7. e3 Nbd7 8. Bd3 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nf3 Re8 11. O-O Be7 12. Bg3 Nf8 13. h3 Be6 14. Rab1 Nh5 15. Bh2 g6 16. Ne5 Ng7 17. b4 Bf5 18. Na4 Bxd3 19. Qxd3 Nd7 20. Rfc1 Nxe5 21. Bxe5 Bd6 22. Bxd6 Qxd6 23. b5 cxb5 24. Qxb5 Ne6
comment:
If 24... Re7, 25 Rc5 Rd8 26 Nc3 and the 'd' Pawn falls.
If 24... b6, 25 Rc6 Qd7 26 Rxb6 and if 25... Qd8, 26 Nc3

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. Qc2 d5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. Bg5 c6 7. e3 Nbd7 8. Bd3 h6 9. Bh4 O-O 10. Nf3 Re8 11. O-O Be7 12. Bg3 Nf8 13. h3 Be6 14. Rab1 Nh5 15. Bh2 g6 16. Ne5 Ng7 17. b4 Bf5 18. Na4 Bxd3 19. Qxd3 Nd7 20. Rfc1 Nxe5 21. Bxe5 Bd6 22. Bxd6 Qxd6 23. b5 cxb5 24. Qxb5 Ne6 25. Nc3
comment: Better than 25 Qb7 which gives Black chances by 25... Reb8 26 Qc6 Qxc6 27 Rxb8+ Rxb8 28 Rxc6 Rb1+ etc.

comment: White not only threatens to capture the Rook but also to win the Queen by 30. Ra1!
